title:
Existence, non-existence and degeneracy of limit solutions to
  $p$-Laplace problems involving Hardy potentials as $p\to1^+$. The case of a
  critical drift
authors: Juan Carlos Ortiz Chata, Francesco Petitta
abstract:
In this paper we analyze the asymptotic behaviour as $p\to 1^+$ of solutions
$u_p$ to $$ \left\{ \begin{array}{rclr} -\Delta_pu&=&\lambda|\nabla
u|^{p-2}\nabla u\cdot\frac{x}{|x|^2}+ f&\quad \mbox{ in } \Omega,\\ u_p&=&0
&\quad \mbox{ on }\partial\Omega, \end{array}\right. $$ where $\Omega$ is a
bounded open subset of $\mathbb{R}^N$ with Lipschitz boundary containing the
origin, $\lambda\in\mathbb{R}$, and $f$ is a nonnegative datum in
$L^{N,\infty}(\Omega)$. As a consequence, under suitable smallness assumptions
on $f$ and $\lambda$, we show sharp existence results of bounded solutions to
the Dirichlet problems $$\begin{cases}
  \displaystyle - \Delta_{1} u = \lambda\frac{D u}{|D u|}\cdot
\frac{x}{|x|^2}+f & \text{in}\, \Omega,
  u=0 & \text{on}\ \partial \Omega,
  \end{cases} $$
  where $\displaystyle \Delta_{1}u=\hbox{div}\,\left(\frac{Du}{|Du|}\right) $
is the $1$-Laplacian operator. The case of a generic drift term in
$L^{N,\infty}(\Omega)$ is also considered.
  Explicits examples are given in order to show the optimality of the main
assumptions on the data.
